body: Should we prefer `std::vector<char>` over `std::vector<uint8_t>`? I always found the latter a bit more suitable to mean "binary data", since it's guaranteed to be a sequence of unsigned bytes. wdyt?
body_html: Should we prefer std::vector<char> over std::vector<uint8_t>? I always found the latter a bit more suitable to mean "binary data", since it's guaranteed to be a sequence of unsigned bytes. wdyt?
body_text: Should we prefer std::vector<char> over std::vector<uint8_t>? I always found the latter a bit more suitable to mean "binary data", since it's guaranteed to be a sequence of unsigned bytes. wdyt?
